Description: Much of a of Corinthian Silhouette Style pottery tripod pyxis lid; underside including flange reserved; dot andf two rings on top of knob, band at top of outside; on lid, in silhouette style, animal procession (part of lion and bird, to right; deer or goat, to left); blobs and dots as filling ornament; to outside, three bands and strokes at edge carried over to vertical face.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Payne, ‘Perachora - Vol. I: Architecture, Bronzes, Terracottas’, Clarendon Press (1940), pl. 33.no. 12; Newhall Stillwell and Benson, ‘Corinth: Results of excavations conducted by the American School of Classical Studies at Athens - Vol. XV, Part 3: The Potters Quarter - The Pottery’ (1984), pl. 54, fig. 1296.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 86, no. A107)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 219, no. 32)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.308) (phase 3)
